extendedIngredients.name: peppermint baking chips
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 package (10 to 12 ounces) white baking chips

recipes.title: Peppermint Swirl Fudge

winePairing.pairingText: Caribbean can be paired with Riesling, Pinot Gris, and Gewurztraminer. You'll want to opt for wines with a bit of sweetness when dealing with spicy Caribbean dishes. Serve these wines chilled so they're even more refreshing. The Pacific Rim Riesling with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Pacific Rim Riesling
productMatches.description: Portraying bright crispness, subtle sweetness and aromas of jasmine, pear and apple, Pacific Rim Riesling exemplifies the harmony of Riesling. The sweetness plays wonderfully with fiery fare (from Thai to Mexican), while the natural acidity stands up to richer foods (from French to German).

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                Line a 9-in. square pan with foil and grease the foil with butter; set aside.                                                                                           In a small saucepan, melt chips; stir until smooth. Remove from the heat. Stir in frosting and extract. Spread into prepared pan. Randomly place drops of food coloring over fudge; cut through fudge with a knife to swirl. Sprinkle with candies. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until set.                                                                                           Using foil, lift fudge out of pan. Gently peel off foil; cut fudge into 1-in. squares. Store in an airtight container.                                        Yield: about 1-1/2 pounds.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Peppermint Swirl Fudge in  Country Woman ChristmasAnnual 2011, p68                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 piece equals 45 calories, 3 g fat (1 g saturated fat), 1 mg cholesterol, 17 mg sodium, 6 g carbohydrate, 0 fiber, trace protein. Diabetic Exchange: 1 starch.                                                                                                                                                                    Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: Line a 9-in. square pan with foil and grease the foil with butter; set aside.
In a small saucepan, melt chips; stir until smooth.
Remove from the heat. Stir in frosting and extract.
Spread into prepared pan. Randomly place drops of food coloring over fudge; cut through fudge with a knife to swirl. Sprinkle with candies. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until set.
Using foil, lift fudge out of pan. Gently peel off foil; cut fudge into 1-in. squares. Store in an airtight container.
